apiKeyPrompt.description: An API key is required to use the AI features. Your key is stored only in your browser and is never saved on the server.
apiKeyPrompt.securityNote: Your API key is stored only in your browser session and cleared when you close the tab.

home.title: AI & Digitalization Consultant
home.subtitle: Your SME's guide to AI and digital transformation
home.duration: The consultation process typically takes 30-60 minutes depending on team size.

llmConfig.title: AI Configuration
llmConfig.hint: Click to configure your AI provider (required for AI-assisted brainstorming)

features.step1Desc: Gather company information through text, files, or web crawling
features.step2Desc: Collaborative 6-3-5 method with up to 6 participants
features.step3Desc: Rank and prioritize generated ideas collaboratively
features.step4Desc: CRISP-DM guided consultation to define objectives and plan your AI project
features.step5Desc: Quantify potential value using the 5-level framework for management buy-in

restoreSession.description: Or continue a previously saved session:

step1.title: Step 1: Company Overview
step1.subtitle: Provide information about your company through text, document uploads, or website crawling

explanation.title: Why we need this information
explanation.description: Understanding your company helps us generate relevant AI and digitalization ideas tailored to your specific situation. The more context you provide, the better the recommendations will be.
explanation.bullet1: Share your business model - what products or services do you offer?
explanation.bullet2: Describe your customers and target market
explanation.bullet3: Mention current challenges you face in daily operations
explanation.bullet4: Include information about your team size and main processes
explanation.tip: You don't need technical knowledge! Just describe your business as you would to a new colleague.

textForm.title: Add Text Information
textForm.label: Describe your company
textForm.placeholder:
Enter information about your company, such as:
- Business model and main products/services
- Target market and customer segments
- Key performance indicators (KPIs)
- Current challenges and opportunities
- Strategic goals and vision
- Team size and structure
textForm.hint: Provide as much detail as possible to help us understand your company.

fileUpload.title: Upload Document
fileUpload.dragDrop: Click to upload or drag and drop

webCrawl.title: Crawl Company Website
webCrawl.hint: Enter your company's website or a page with relevant information (About Us, Company Profile, etc.)
webCrawl.tip: Tip: The crawler will extract the page title, meta description, headings, and main content. For best results, provide a link to your "About Us" or company profile page.

companyInfo.title: Collected Information
companyInfo.addInfo: Add information using the forms above

step1a.title: Step 1a: Company Overview
step1a.subtitle: Provide information about your company through text, document uploads, or website crawling

explanation.title: Why we need this information
explanation.description: Understanding your company helps us generate relevant AI and digitalization ideas tailored to your specific situation. The more context you provide, the better the recommendations will be.
explanation.bullet1: Share your business model - what products or services do you offer?
explanation.bullet2: Describe your customers and target market
explanation.bullet3: Mention current challenges you face in daily operations
explanation.bullet4: Include information about your team size and main processes
explanation.tip: You don't need technical knowledge! Just describe your business as you would to a new colleague.

step1b.title: Step 1b: Digital Maturity Assessment
step1b.subtitle: Evaluate your company's Industry 4.0 readiness using the acatech Maturity Index

explanation.title: What is the acatech Maturity Index?
explanation.description: The acatech Industry 4.0 Maturity Index is a standardized framework developed by the German Academy of Science and Engineering. It helps organizations understand their current digital transformation status and identify areas for improvement.
explanation.bullet1: Rate your company across 4 key dimensions on a scale of 1-6
explanation.bullet2: Level 1 (Computerization) to Level 6 (Adaptability) represents increasing digital maturity
explanation.bullet3: The assessment helps identify specific areas where digitalization can have the most impact
explanation.bullet4: Your results will be used to tailor AI recommendations to your current maturity level
explanation.tip: Answer honestly based on your current state, not where you hope to be. This helps us provide realistic recommendations.

resources.title: Resources
resources.description: Digital capability of your workforce, equipment, materials, and tools
resources.q1: How digitally skilled is your workforce? (1 = basic computer use, 6 = AI/data science capabilities)
resources.q2: How connected and smart are your equipment and machines? (1 = manual, 6 = fully autonomous)
resources.q3: How well are your materials and inventory tracked digitally? (1 = paper-based, 6 = real-time IoT tracking)
resources.q4: How advanced are your digital tools and software? (1 = basic office, 6 = AI-powered enterprise systems)

informationSystems.title: Information Systems
informationSystems.description: Integration of IT systems and data processing capabilities
informationSystems.q1: How integrated are your IT systems? (1 = isolated silos, 6 = fully integrated ecosystem)
informationSystems.q2: How accessible is your business data? (1 = hard to find, 6 = real-time dashboards everywhere)
informationSystems.q3: How automated is your data collection? (1 = manual entry, 6 = automatic from all sources)
informationSystems.q4: How advanced is your data analysis? (1 = spreadsheets, 6 = AI/ML predictive analytics)

culture.title: Culture
culture.q1: How open is your organization to change? (1 = resistant, 6 = actively seeking innovation)
culture.q2: How well does knowledge flow across departments? (1 = siloed, 6 = open collaboration culture)
culture.q3: How is failure treated? (1 = punished, 6 = seen as learning opportunity)
culture.q4: How committed is leadership to digitalization? (1 = skeptical, 6 = strategic priority)

organizationalStructure.title: Organizational Structure
organizationalStructure.q1: How agile are your teams? (1 = rigid hierarchies, 6 = self-organizing teams)
organizationalStructure.q2: How fast can you make decisions? (1 = weeks/months, 6 = real-time data-driven)
organizationalStructure.q3: How do teams collaborate across functions? (1 = rarely, 6 = cross-functional by default)
organizationalStructure.q4: How quickly can you adapt to market changes? (1 = very slow, 6 = immediate pivots possible)

step2.title: Step 2: 6-3-5 Brainstorming
step2.subtitle: Interactive brainstorming session with AI assistants

explanation.title: What is 6-3-5 Brainstorming?
explanation.description: The 6-3-5 method is a proven creativity technique: 6 participants each write 3 ideas in 5 minutes, then pass their sheet to the next person who builds upon those ideas. This creates a rich collection of ideas in just 30 minutes.
explanation.bullet1: No idea is too small or too crazy - quantity matters more than perfection
explanation.bullet2: AI assistants join to fill empty seats and contribute additional perspectives
explanation.bullet3: Each round, you'll see previous ideas to inspire new thinking
explanation.bullet4: Don't worry if you're not an AI expert - everyday process improvements count too!
explanation.tip: Think about repetitive tasks, communication bottlenecks, or areas where you wish you had better data or faster decisions.

share.title: Invite Participants
share.scanQR: Scan this QR code to join the session

join.title: Join Brainstorming Session
join.description: Enter your name to join the 6-3-5 brainstorming session. AI assistants will fill any remaining slots (up to 6 total participants).
join.sessionStarted: Session has already started. You cannot join at this time.
join.rule2: AI assistants fill remaining slots (max 6 total)
join.alreadyJoined: You have already joined this session

session.aiNote: AI assistants will be added to fill up to 6 participants
session.skipNote: You can skip brainstorming and enter ideas manually in Step 4
session.skipConfirm: Are you sure you want to skip the 6-3-5 brainstorming session? Any ideas created so far will be preserved, but you will proceed to the next step.
session.waitingForOwner: Waiting for the session creator to start...
session.waitingForOwnerNote: Only the person who created this session can start the brainstorming.

progress.allSubmitted: All participants have submitted their ideas!
progress.waitingForOwnerAdvance: Waiting for the session creator to advance to the next round...

ideaSheet.submittedMessage: You've submitted your ideas for this round!
ideaSheet.waitingForOthers: Waiting for other participants to finish...

complete.title: Brainstorming Complete!
complete.message: Great work! All ideas have been collected.

step3.title: Step 3: Idea Prioritization
step3.subtitle: Allocate your {{points}} points to your favorite ideas

explanation.title: Why prioritize ideas?
explanation.description: Not all ideas are equally valuable or feasible for your company. By voting on ideas, we identify which opportunities resonate most with your team and should be explored further.
explanation.bullet1: You have 3 points to distribute - give more points to ideas you find most promising
explanation.bullet2: Consider both impact (how much value it could create) and feasibility (can you actually do it?)
explanation.bullet3: The top-rated idea will be the focus for the detailed consultation in the next steps
explanation.tip: Trust your instincts! You know your business best. Technical feasibility can be assessed later.

noIdeas.title: No Ideas to Prioritize
noIdeas.message: You skipped the 6-3-5 brainstorming session without creating any ideas. You can proceed directly to the consultation step where you'll enter ideas manually.

voting.clickToAdd: Click + to add points to ideas you like
voting.allocateAll: Please allocate all {{total}} points. You have {{remaining}} remaining.
voting.noParticipant: No participant found. Please go back to Step 2 and join the session first.

results.votesRecorded: Your votes have been recorded! Here are the current results:

step4.title: Step 4: Business Understanding
step4.subtitle: CRISP-DM guided consultation to understand business objectives and plan your AI project

explanation.title: What is CRISP-DM?
explanation.description: CRISP-DM (Cross-Industry Standard Process for Data Mining) is a widely-used framework for planning AI and data projects. We'll guide you through the 'Business Understanding' phase - the crucial first step that ensures your AI project addresses real business needs.
explanation.bullet1: We'll clarify your business goals - what success looks like for this project
explanation.bullet2: We'll assess your current situation - resources, constraints, and data availability
explanation.bullet3: We'll translate business goals into technical AI objectives
explanation.bullet4: We'll outline a realistic project plan with clear phases
explanation.tip: Answer the questions as honestly as possible. There are no wrong answers - the goal is to understand your specific situation.

manualEntry.title: Manual Idea Entry Required
manualEntry.message: Please enter at least one idea to proceed with the consultation.
manualEntry.atLeastOne: Please enter at least one idea

chat.startMessage: The AI consultant will guide you through the CRISP-DM Business Understanding phase, asking one question at a time.
chat.collaborativePlaceholder: Type your message (all participants can contribute)...
chat.collaborativeHint: In collaborative mode: Send messages to contribute, then click 'Request AI Response' when ready for feedback.

collaborative.description: Multiple participants can join and contribute to this consultation session. Share the link below to invite others.
collaborative.shareInstructions: Share this link or QR code with other participants to let them join the consultation.

step5.title: Step 5: Business Case & Cost Estimation
step5.subtitle: Evaluate potentials and estimate costs for your AI project

explanation.title: Building a Business Case
explanation.description: A solid business case helps you get management buy-in and justify investment in AI. We'll use the 5-level value framework to quantify the potential benefits of your project.
explanation.bullet1: Budget Substitution: Can AI replace external services you currently pay for?
explanation.bullet2: Process Efficiency: Will AI save time in routine tasks?
explanation.bullet3: Project Acceleration: Can AI speed up development or time-to-market?
explanation.bullet4: Risk Mitigation: Will AI help avoid costly errors or quality issues?
explanation.bullet5: Strategic Scaling: Can AI help you grow without proportionally increasing costs?
explanation.tip: Don't worry about exact numbers. Rough estimates ('ballpark figures') are perfectly fine at this stage.

costsExplanation.title: Understanding Project Costs
costsExplanation.description: Getting a realistic cost estimate helps you plan your budget and set expectations with stakeholders. We'll break down costs into initial investment, recurring costs, and total cost of ownership.
costsExplanation.bullet1: Initial Investment: Development, integration, and training costs (one-time)
costsExplanation.bullet2: Recurring Costs: Cloud infrastructure, licenses, API usage (monthly/yearly)
costsExplanation.bullet3: Maintenance: Updates, monitoring, support (15-20% of initial annually)
costsExplanation.bullet4: Total Cost of Ownership: Full 3-year cost projection for budgeting
costsExplanation.tip: Cost varies significantly based on complexity. A quick win might cost 5k-15k, while enterprise solutions can exceed 150k.

chat.startMessage: The AI consultant will help you develop a business case using the 5-level value framework.

costs.startMessage: The AI consultant will help you estimate realistic costs for your AI project.

findings.title: Business Case Indication
findings.subtitle: 5-Level Value Framework Analysis
findings.classificationPlaceholder: Which value level(s) apply to this project
findings.validationPlaceholder: Questions to strengthen the business case

costsFindings.title: Cost Estimation
costsFindings.subtitle: Project Investment Analysis
costsFindings.complexityPlaceholder: Project complexity level (Quick Win to Enterprise)
costsFindings.tcoPlaceholder: Total Cost of Ownership over 3 years

step6.title: Step 6: Export & Technical Handover
step6.subtitle: Review your findings and prepare for the Technical Understanding phase

explanation.title: DMME Methodology: From Business to Technical Understanding
explanation.description: You've completed the Business Understanding phase. The Technical Transition Briefing prepares the handover to the next phase: Technical Understanding & Conceptualization, where technical experts analyze data sources, systems, and implementation approaches.
explanation.bullet1: Review all collected findings from your consultation journey
explanation.bullet2: Generate a Technical Briefing that translates business needs into technical questions
explanation.bullet3: The briefing identifies enablers, blockers, and hypotheses for implementation
explanation.bullet4: Export a comprehensive PDF report for stakeholders and technical teams
explanation.tip: The Technical Briefing is designed for IT/OT managers or external consultants who will develop the technical solution.

incomplete.companyInfo: No company information collected. Go to Step 1a.
incomplete.maturity: No maturity assessment completed. Go to Step 1b.
incomplete.crispDm: No CRISP-DM findings. Complete the consultation in Step 4.
incomplete.businessCase: No business case generated. Complete Step 5a.
